page.title: 04Ditchling Lifestyles
page.content: Questioning the children of St.Margaret's C.E.Primary School revealed interesting facts.The majority of children were not born in the village and few of their parents work there,most commute to Brighton (5 miles) or London (55 miles).Local shops are not used for major purchases but most shopping was done in nearby towns.Most families had annual holidays often to exotic places including West Africa, Tenerife and Australia.Every family owned at least one car and the majority had central heating;only one house had solar heating.The children do not regard the village as the centre for their recreation.This emphasises the considerable divide that exists in the population;The many well_to_do and retired folk have little to do with the school and enjoy the village life.
